main event: A bright silvery object was observed in the southwestern sky while returning from Westville to LaPorte, Indiana on July 30, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as very large and moving rapidly across the sky., It was observed for approximately 1 minute and 30 seconds at an estimated altitude of 1,000 feet., The object emitted a bright light and was moving at an estimated speed of 1,000 miles per hour., The sighting occurred around 10:00 PM under potentially clear weather conditions., No physical evidence or photographs were obtained, leaving the object unidentified.
sighted object: a bright silvery object emitting light
witness description: The witness reported seeing the object while traveling by road.
